title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling classes from a subpackage using ajc without the -d option, a directory named "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: But it will be nice to have the same behavior as javac, where a directory named "subpackage" is not created.
SR: Use the -d option while correctly compiling classes from the subpackage.
